issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Enable join and aggregate materialized view rewriting

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Testing Infrastructure
components.description: Tracks issues with tests and testing infrastructure.

fields.summary: Make comparison of filter predicates in q files deterministic

comments.body: Expecting quite a 'few' q file changes...
[~jcamachorodriguez]: I think the Quickstep folks recommended sorting the AND and OR by selectivity

[~gopalv], that would make sense: ascending selectivity for AND (less selective first) and descending for OR. Observe however that this fix only applies to explain plans in test mode (it's purpose was only remove the determinism in the explain for the tests). I think we could check in this fix to unlock HIVE-17432. Or maybe I should just create the fix with the sort on selectivity for all cases and cancel this one (I would still need to provide determinism for testing in case of selectivity draw). Thoughts? Cc [~ashutoshc]
[~jcamachorodriguez]: I didn't catch the in.test part - Think we've ignored the determinism for the actual queries for quite a while now.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12886548/HIVE-17510.patch

{color:red}ERROR:{color} -1 due to no test(s) being added or modified.

{color:red}ERROR:{color} -1 due to 456 failed/errored test(s), 11036 tests executed
*Failed tests:*
